job.title: AWS Site Reliability Engineer
job.description:
This is a 100% Remote Role!
This Jobot Job is hosted by Kyle Shaw
Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button and sending us your resume.
Salary $135,000 - $200,000 per year
A Bit About Us
We are a tech unicorn building a digital experience platform that leverages tons of data to provide global businesses and brands insights to best build hyper-personalized customer experiences when engaging with their digital platforms and sites. We work with some of the biggest brands in the world across industries.
We've been growing rapidly and are looking to significantly expand our infrastructure team by hiring several Site Reliability Engineers.
Why join us?
We provide a lucrative compensation package with competitive pay, great medical and dental benefits, Flex PTO, and 401k + matching. As a fully-remote team, we embrace work flexibility and work / life balance. Our culture matters most to us, and we value collaboration, no ego's, and team-players who enjoy working with their colleagues.
We have a unique and diverse team make up and hire with a tech-agnostic approach, allowing us to hire some of the sharpest minds in the industry, regardless of technical or development language experience.
Job Details
As a AWS Site Reliability Engineer, you'll be responsible for rebuilding and refining our cloud infrastructure from the ground up to better automate, scale, and improve the stability and security of our cloud environment. We are seeking a SRE with strong cloud experience that loves automation and has worked in cloud environments holding significant amounts of data.
Our infrastructure is predominantly hosted in AWS along with a bit of GCP, and we are in the midst of containerizing our environment with Kubernetes.
Qualifications
4+ years of Site Reliability / DevOps Engineering experience
Experience building, scaling, and automating cloud environments (AWS preferred but open to Azure of GCP)
Loves writing Infrastructure as Code (IaC) with Terraform or Cloudformation
Strong scripter capable of writing automation scripts with Bash, Python, Ruby, or related languages
Experience managing and handling large amounts of data
Exposure to big data / data streaming tools like Kafka, Spark, Samza, Hadoop, Hbase, etc.
Configuration Management experience with Chef, Puppet, or Ansible
Experience standing up and automating CI/CD pipelines
Containerization experience with Docker, Kubernetes, ECS, GKE, or related tool
Plusses
BS in Computer Science or related field
Loves collaboration
Enjoys bringing new ideas to the table
Likes challenges and operates with a tech agnostic approach using the best tools at hand
Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button.
